New Records: The Blue Jays set a new franchise record with their highest scoring game (15 runs) in team history.
José Berríos achieved his 14th win of the season, moving closer to his career milestone of 20 wins.
Key Match Events: Daulton Varsho and Spencer Horwitz hit two home runs in a seven-run first inning, which was a turning point in the game.
José Berríos pitched six shutout innings, keeping the Twins' bats quiet and contributing to the Blue Jays' dominant performance.
Pre-Game Insights: The Blue Jays entered the game with a 67-71 record and a 33-38 road record, looking to turn their season around.
The Twins, with a 73-62 record and a strong 38-30 home record, were aiming to maintain their playoff momentum.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Target Field in Minneapolis, Minnesota, with an attendance of 30,517 fans.
The game time lasted two hours and 30 minutes, ending with a decisive 15-0 victory for the Blue Jays.
